com.igormaznitsa.prol.logic.triggers
Class ProlTriggerGoal

java.lang.Object
  com.igormaznitsa.prol.logic.triggers.AbstractProlTrigger
      com.igormaznitsa.prol.logic.triggers.ProlTriggerGoal
All Implemented Interfaces:
ProlTrigger
public class ProlTriggerGoal
extends AbstractProlTrigger

Class implements the Prol Trigger and allows to process a goal when there is the trigger condition It's impossible to process the context halting state with a goal trigger because the context has halted status already when it is calling triggers

Author:
Igor Maznitsa (igor.maznitsa@igormaznitsa.com)

          Inside variable containing work context for the trigger

Method Summary
 void onContextHalting(ProlContext context)
          The function will be called only once when a prol context (where the trigger has been registered one or more times), is halting (the halted state already set on the context so it is not possible to process goals)

Constructor Detail

ProlTriggerGoal

public ProlTriggerGoal(java.lang.String triggerGoal,
                       ProlContext context,
                       TraceListener tracer)
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       java.lang.InterruptedException
A constructor allows to make a goal from a string automatically

Parameters:
triggerGoal - the goal as String, it will be solved when there is the trigger event, can be null if it is undefined
context - the work context for the trigger, must not be null
tracer - the tracer to listen events of the trigger goal, it can be null
Throws:
java.io.IOException - it will be thrown if there is any IO exception during the constructor
java.lang.InterruptedException - it will be thrown if the operation will be interrupted

ProlTriggerGoal

public ProlTriggerGoal(Term triggerGoal,
                       ProlContext context,
                       TraceListener tracer)
A constructor allows to make prepared trigger for already parsed goal

Parameters:
triggerGoal - the parsed goal, can be null if undefined
context - the work context for the trigger, must not be null
tracer - the tracer to listen events of the trigger goal, it can be null
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the context is null
Method Detail

onTriggerEvent

public void onTriggerEvent(TriggerEvent event)
                    throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Description copied from interface: ProlTrigger
The funnction will be called when the context fidn out that there is inside assert or retract operation over a predicate mapped on the trigger

Parameters:
event - the event object describes the operation over the predicate, must not be null
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - it will be thrown if handling is interrupted

onContextHalting

public void onContextHalting(ProlContext context)
Description copied from interface: ProlTrigger
The function will be called only once when a prol context (where the trigger has been registered one or more times), is halting (the halted state already set on the context so it is not possible to process goals)

Parameters:
context - the signaler , must not be null
